args.query: mathlib4 Submodule codim codimension submodule codim of submodule mathlib4

args.content:
import Mathlib

/--
Suppose K is a field and V is a finite-dimensional vector space over K.
Let T : V →ₗ[K] V be a linear map such that every subspace of V of codimension 1
(i.e., every kernel of a nonzero linear functional) is invariant under T.
Then T is a scalar multiple of the identity.
-/
theorem Axler_exercise_5_13 {K : Type _} [Field K] {V : Type _} [AddCommGroup V] [Module K V]
  [FiniteDimensional K V]
  (T : V →ₗ[K] V)
  (h : ∀ (φ : V →ₗ[K] K), φ ≠ 0 → (Submodule.map T φ.ker) ≤ φ.ker) :
  ∃ (c : K), T = c • LinearMap.id := by sorry

args.natural_language_statement: Translate to Lean4: Let K be a field, V a finite-dimensional vector space over K, and T : V →ₗ[K] V a linear map. Assume every codimension-1 subspace (i.e., for every nonzero linear functional φ : V →ₗ[K] K, the kernel LinearMap.ker φ) is invariant under T: Submodule.map T (LinearMap.ker φ) ≤ LinearMap.ker φ. Prove that T is a scalar multiple of the identity: ∃ c : K, T = c • LinearMap.id. End the Lean4 statement with := by sorry and import Mathlib at the top.

args.content:
import Mathlib

/--
Suppose K is a field and V is a finite-dimensional vector space over K.
Let T : V →ₗ[K] V be a linear map such that every subspace of V of codimension 1
(i.e., every kernel of a nonzero linear functional) is invariant under T.
Then T is a scalar multiple of the identity.
-/
theorem Axler_exercise_5_13 {K : Type _} [Field K] {V : Type _} [AddCommGroup V] [Module K V]
  [FiniteDimensional K V]
  (T : V →ₗ[K] V)
  (h : ∀ (φ : V →ₗ[K] K), φ ≠ 0 → Submodule.map T (LinearMap.ker φ) ≤ LinearMap.ker φ) :
  ∃ (c : K), T = c • LinearMap.id := by sorry
